com.mesosphere.mesos.rx.java.test.simulation

Class AwaitableEventSubscriberDecorator<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • rx.Subscriber<T>
      • com.mesosphere.mesos.rx.java.test.simulation.AwaitableEventSubscriberDecorator<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of event that will be sent into this subscriber.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    rx.Observer<T>, rx.Subscription

    public final class AwaitableEventSubscriberDecorator<T>
extends rx.Subscriber<T>
    A Subscriber that will decorate a provided Subscriber adding the ability for a client to "block" until an event is observed, at which point the client can proceed. This class is really only useful in the context of writing tests.

    TRACE level logging can be enable for this class to see exactly what is happening in the subscriber while events are flowing in or while awaiting event(s).

      Creates the decorator based on wrapping the provided obs.

    • Method Detail

      • onNext

        public void onNext(T t)

        public void onError(Throwable e)

      • onCompleted

        public void onCompleted()

      • awaitEvent

        public void awaitEvent()
                throws InterruptedException
        Block the invoking thread until 1 event is observed by this instance. Any of onNext(Object), onError(Throwable) or onCompleted() are considered to be events.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - Throw in the waiting thread is interrupted.

      • awaitEvent

        public void awaitEvent(int eventCount)
                throws InterruptedException
        Block the invoking thread until eventCount events are observed by this instance. Any of onNext(Object), onError(Throwable) or onCompleted() are considered to be events.

        In the case of onError(Throwable) or onCompleted() being invoked this method will return regardless of the value of eventCount.

        Parameters:
        eventCount - The number of events to block and wait for
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - Throw in the waiting thread is interrupted.
